comments:
I'm not sure if this is the right place to submit this bug....

I'm testing a 2.1.2 plugin binary in integration build #200402102000

and I can into an exception when plugin.xml contains a minor error that works 
ok in 2.1.2

<runtime>
  <library name="xmlui.jar">
    <export name="*"/>
  </library>
  <library name=""/>
</runtime> 

Note the empty library entry.

The exception I get occurs in 

BundleLoader.getClassPath(Bundle bundle, Properties props) throws 
BundleException 

Seems the result of the call: 

String spec = bundle.getBundleData().getClassPath();

returns:

spec= "xmlui.jar," <-- note the comma!

and that comma kills the next call:

ManifestElement.parseClassPath(spec)

Here's the stack trace...

The pluginconverter is not as tolerant as the plugin.xml parser used to be, so 
the empty entry in the library causes problems.

This will be fixed for M8.

For now, please change your plugin.xml to remove the empty library entry.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 51745 ***

Sorry for the dupe. Didn't find it during my search!

thx

Geoff
